note.p: Death: 102 Cheyne Walk, Chelsea, London (21 June 1885)
Education: Westminster School; Balliol College, Oxford. BA (1840), MA (1842)
Career: Staff, Department of Antiquities, British Museum (1841); Keeper of Coins and Medals, British Museum (1861-1870); catalogued the coins in the Bodleian Library (1871-1876)
Memberships: FNS (President); RSL; FSA; MRAS; FRGS; Royal Asiatic Society
